Author: ivan

Author: tx
Content:
Look, this discussion is getting silly. I can give you a list of 100 applications that will never go online. And you can give me your list of 100 applications that should be online. And both of us will be absolutely right.

\nBut slogans like "desktop apps are dead" (just like popular "everything will be XML" a few years ago) are plain stupid. The application you spend most of your time in front of is a "desktop app", it's called a browser.

\n

Author: plusbryan
Content: I doubt it will take any market away from IE. Those who know anything use firefox. Like the green party candidate that steals 5% of the vote and gets a republican elected, I think all this will do is take a chunk out of firefox's base.

Author: jwp
Content: Yeah, yeah, so the engineering part wasn't that great. But were the results good? Which algorithms did you use? What were your features? Seems like an interesting experiment, especially with all the gratuitous "friending" people do. Reminds me of a related paper: http://www.hpl.hp.com/research/idl/papers/facebook/facebook.pdf
